p: Plant VOCs easily react with O 3 and samples may be destroyed if ozone scrubbers are not used in sampling ( Blande et al., 2014). O 3 exposure experiments have shown that plant VOC responses are variable and depend on the O 3 concentration ( Peñuelas and Staudt, 2010). Acute ozone exposure can induce similar VOCs to herbivore damage ( Blande et al., 2014). Moderately elevated O 3 concentrations increase emissions of MTs in coniferous ( Kivimäenpää et al., 2013, 2016; Ghimire et al., 2017) and deciduous trees ( Carriero et al., 2016), but decrease isoprene emission in poplar ( Yuan et al., 2016) and MT emissions in Larix were not affected ( Mochizuki et al., 2017).
